description: Highest common factor of nonzero digits of n.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(46)=2 because highest common factor of 4 and 6 is 2.
prog: (PARI) a(n) = {digs = digits(n, 10); hcf = digs[1]; for (i = 2, #digs, if (digs[i], hcf = gcd(hcf, digs[i]));); return (hcf);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 27 2013(Haskell)a052423 n = f n n where   f x 1 = 1   f x y | x < 10    = gcd x y         | otherwise = if d == 1 then 1 else f x' (gcd d y)         where (x', d) = divMod x 10-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 14 2014
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Mar 17 2000
